speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Bob Daily  * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}    _ACT ONE  Scenes from[[10.24]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_24/a_new_position_for_roz.html "A New Position For Roz") "A New Position for Roz"_  **PREVIOUSLY**

speaker: Julia
text: Are you trying to save Frasier from me, or are you trying to save him for yourself?

speaker: Roz
text: Are you out of you out of your mind?

speaker: Julia
text: Are you in love with him? _CUT TO:  Roz confronting Frasier at his apartment._

speaker: Roz
text: It's her or me!  Tell me now, or I swear to God, I will walk out of here and I will not come back!

speaker: Wiswell
text: There's no chance you'll change your mind again, is there?

speaker: Roz
text: No.  KACL is ancient history. **SUBSEQUENTLY**  _Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa FADE IN Niles is sitting at a table, Roz comes up. _

speaker: Roz
text: Niles, I need to talk to you.  You're not with Frasier, are you?

speaker: Niles
text: Why does everybody treat us like we're joined at the hip? I do have coffee with other people other than my brother, you know.

speaker: Roz
text: Good.  'Cause I'm avoiding him.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, then talk fast.  He's meeting me in five minutes.

speaker: Roz
text: It's about my new job.  It's a nightmare!

speaker: Niles
text: Didn't you just start today?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.  My boss already hit on me, I'm supposed to work nights and weekends, and my assistant is an idiot and I can't fire her 'cause she's like three minorities rolled into one.  I can't believe I left KACL over some stupid snit.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, yes, your ultimatum.  Frasier told me about that. Listen, this isn't an easy subject to broach, but is it possible you're in love with Frasier?

speaker: Roz
text: Absolutely not.

speaker: Niles
text: You sound sure.

speaker: Roz
text: I am sure.  I mean, if I were going to fall for him it would have been two years ago when we slept together.

speaker: Niles
text: Well then, another theory I'd like to explore is... HO, back up!  You and Frasier slept together?

speaker: Roz
text: He didn't tell you?

speaker: Niles
text: No... Well, I suppose it's only natural.  When the wolf and the lamb work together, it's only a matter of time before the wolf gets his way.  I hope you were gentle with him.

speaker: Roz
text: Just promise you won't tell him I told you.

speaker: Niles
text: I promise, I promise.  So, you're not in love.  But your behavior last night clearly indicates some sort of crisis. As a psychiatrist...

speaker: Roz
text: I just want my job back.  I'm not looking for some big therapy trip.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  Well, why don't you just sweep your emotions under the rug and waltz back to the station as if nothing ever happened.

speaker: Roz
text: That's _perfect_!   Thanks!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.   I was being facetious.  My real advice would be...

speaker: Roz
text: I know.  Talk about my feelings.  Blah, blah, woof, woof. I gotta go, Niles.  Thanks again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello, Roz.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello Darling.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, we're all set.  I got us a home pregnancy test, a basal body thermometer and ovulation kit.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's perfect.  I can upload all your data into this fertility program I bought.

speaker: Martin
text: You kids sure know how to keep the romance alive. [to the waiter] Two coffees, please.  Since when do you need a chemistry set to have a baby?

speaker: Daphne
text: I hear an "In my day..." coming.

speaker: Martin
text: In my day it was simple: girl would put on something slinky, guy comes home, has a couple of pops, throws some Dean Martin on the Hi-Fi and bim-bam-boom, you're lightin' a Lucky.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, Daphne.  Hi.  Niles, I've got to cancel our date, I have to meet Roz's replacement over at the station before the show.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's this?  Are you pregnant?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not yet, but we're trying.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, congratulations.  You've got all the fertility software and so forth?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.  We're not animals.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're very excited.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, we were up half the night imagining life with our first child.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, first child you know about.

speaker: Daphne
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?  Oh, it's not what you think, Daphne.  I was just referring to the time Niles sold his sperm to a sperm bank.  Surely you told her about it. _Niles looks flustered and is unable to speak as Daphne gives him a sharp glance._

speaker: Frasier
text: Off I go.

speaker: Daphne
text: You sold your sperm?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it was when I was home from medical school.  I saw an ad for sperm donors, so I sold my sperm to a sperm bank...

speaker: Martin
text: Would you stop using that word?!  Say "s."

speaker: Niles
text: I sold my "s" to earn some money so I could buy Dad a Christmas present.

speaker: Martin
text: Which present?

speaker: Niles
text: The fishing pole.

speaker: Martin
text: You bought that with "s" money?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why didn't you tell me?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it was such a long time ago it completely slipped my mind. You're not really upset, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Well of course I am!  That was my favorite pole.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just thought this would be the first child for both of us. You could be a daddy already.  There could be dozens of little Niles Cranes running around. [_points to a man_] HE could be your son. [_points to another_] Or HIM.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please, they look nothing like me.  Besides, I only went down there one time.  It's entirely possible they never used my sample.

speaker: Man
text: Can I borrow your sugar?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: I better look into this. **SHE'S ACK-BAY**  _Scene Two - KACL FADE IN  Kenny and Frasier come into the hallway outside the producer's booth, where a young lady is at the console._

speaker: Kenny
text: There she is.  Now, I gotta warn you, Doc, she's uh, in a eelchair-way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Does her handicap preclude her from understanding Pig Latin?

speaker: Kenny
text: Doctor Frasier Crane, king of the shrinks, meet Dana Willoughby, queen of the sound booth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Dana.

speaker: Dana
text: Oh, it's my pleasure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise, I'm sure.  Listen, if you have any questions, anything you'd like to know, please feel free to call on me.  I'm here for you.

speaker: Dana
text: You know, actually, there was one...

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia!

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, we still on for dinner at Chez Henri tonight?

speaker: Julia
text: Of course.  Do you have reservations?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not as long as you're wearing something black and slinky.

speaker: Dana
text: Ten seconds, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, why don't you stop by my place tonight for a cocktail first?

speaker: Julia
text: I'll see you at seven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay. _He hurries to his desk and punches the mike up.  He starts talking even as he's putting on his headset._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Seattle, this is Dr. Frasier Crane.  Our topic today is: new beginnings.  I'd like you all to join me in welcoming a new member to the KACL family. _CUT TO: the hallway.  Kenny is at the vending machine and Roz walks past._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Kenny.  Sorry I'm late.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Roz... Whoa, whoa!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: I work here!

speaker: Kenny
text: You quit.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, Kenny.  If I quit, would I be here?  Who's that?

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm sorry, I hired her because I thought... didn't you quit?

speaker: Roz
text: Kenny, what's wrong with you?  Never mind.  I'll fix it, like always.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, thanks, Roz.  I owe you one.

speaker: Frasier
text: As many of you may know, my producer of ten years, Roz Doyle, has left us for greener pastures. _Through the window, we can see Roz taking off Dana's headset and pulling her away from the console.  Frasier doesn't notice._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz was not only known for her producing prowess, but also for her warmth, her kindness and her gentle spirit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well, then, the beginning of a new era.  Let's go to our first caller.

speaker: Roz
text: [_back at her console_] We have Scott on line two. _Frasier rears back in shock, knocking his headset off.  Roz just smiles at him.  FADE TO:_ **THE S BANK**  _Scene Three - The S Bank Niles is standing in the waiting area, a nurse (Karen) is at the counter._

speaker: Karen
text: Niles Crane?

speaker: Karen
text: Hi.  I'll get you a cup and you can start...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I've already donated my essence to your establishment, now I'd like to get it back.

speaker: Karen
text: I'm sorry.  It's against our policy to return essences.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I see.  Well, could I at least check and see whether my donation was used?

speaker: Niles
text: You know, see if my deposit has drawn any interest. [_grins_]

speaker: Karen
text: Sir, I've worked here twenty-eight years.  Think you can tell me one I haven't heard?  Go ahead, try me.

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Karen
text: [_off the computer_] According to our records, your sample wasn't used.

speaker: Niles
text: So there are no little Niles Cranes running around.  What a relief.

speaker: Karen
text: [_sarcastically_] Isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you for your time.

speaker: Niles
text: Just a quick question: based on my qualifications, I'd assumed there'd be some interest.  Any nibbles?

speaker: Karen
text: According to our records, your sample was discarded.  It was rated sub-standard.

speaker: Niles
text: "Sub-standard"?

speaker: Karen
text: Your sperm had very low motility.

speaker: Niles
text: So they're...

speaker: Karen
text: Slow movers.

speaker: Niles
text: Really.  But that was more than twenty years ago.  There's a chance that my situation's improved since then, isn't there?

speaker: Karen
text: Can YOU run faster now than you could twenty years ago?

speaker: Niles
text: So you're saying it might be difficult for my wife and me to conceive?

speaker: Karen
text: Very difficult, yes.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, thank you. _He turns and walks across the room.  When he opens the door, there is a startled yell._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, sir!  Terribly sorry.  Carry on. _He closes the door, then goes to the exit the nurse is pointing at.  FADE OUT  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene One - Frasier's Apartment FADE IN  Eddie is on the coffee table, his head buried in a bag of Cheetos. The doorbell rings and Martin comes in from the kitchen to answer it._

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie, you get stuck in there again and you're on your own. _Eddie pulls free of the bag and jumps over to the couch.  Martin opens the door to reveal Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.  Is Frasier here?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, primping.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.

speaker: Martin
text: He's going out with Julia.

speaker: Niles
text: Right, right.  Daphne's going out with her mom tonight, so I thought I'd borrow a DVD.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, you're in luck.  I just picked this one up: "Crime Scene Bloopers 4: You Have the Right to Remain Zany."

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds tempting, but I'm looking for something a little more soothing.  I didn't have the best day.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Got some bad news at the "s" bank.  Apparently I suffer from low motility. _As he speaks, Niles walks around, shifting his loose baggy pants around._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Sorry, son.  How'd Daphne take it?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, well I haven't had the heart to tell her yet.  But I'm hoping I won't have to.  I did some research today and I found out, there's some things I can do to... rouse the troops.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah?  Like what?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, for instance wearing baggy pants.  And boxers instead of briefs.  Studies show that men who allow their genitals to swing freely...

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, got it!

speaker: Niles
text: And well, no hot baths, no alcohol, raw seafood, uh... and I started a regimen of dietary supplements.  Which reminds me...

speaker: Martin
text: What's that?

speaker: Niles
text: French maritime pine bark extract.  It boosts fertility and also acts as a mild euphoric.  Which accounts for the well- known joviality of French sailors.

speaker: Niles
text: Terrible aftertaste, though. _He grabs a Cheeto and pops it into his mouth, then makes a face of his own._

speaker: Niles
text: I thought those were supposed to be crunchy. _Martin just shrugs and looks innocent.  Frasier comes in from the bedrooms._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.  Dad, Julia is on her way, you told me you'd keep to your room while she's here.

speaker: Frasier
text: And take your Cheetos-stained dog with you.

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie, come on boy. _Martin leads Eddie off as Niles notices his orange muzzle.  A look of disturbed realization crosses his face._

speaker: Niles
text: I'll be leaving too.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, could you stay for just a moment?  There's something going on in my life that requires a bit of mulling.  Sherry?

speaker: Niles
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: No?  But we never mull without sherry.

speaker: Niles
text: Not for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well.  Have a seat.

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, I'd rather stand.

speaker: Frasier
text: Suit yourself.  Anyway, it's about Roz.  After quitting her job, TWICE, she shows up back at work again, today, waist-deep in a sea of denial.  Well, I confronted her on the issue...

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry, go on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, I confronted her on the issue, and she refused to discuss it with me.  She wouldn't even look me in the eye. Which leads me to just one conclusion, Niles: She's in love with me.

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't necessarily jump to that conclusion...

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because you don't have all the facts.  I've never shared this with you before, Niles, so brace yourself. Two years ago, Roz and I slept together.

speaker: Niles
text: [_feigning shock_] GET OUT!  You and Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: We did have a chance to discuss it, thoroughly.  Talk things out.  And at the time, she seemed happy to remain friends. But I realize, now, that I must have kindled a spark in her. That lit the torch she carries to this day.  So what do you think...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are your pants humming?

speaker: Niles
text: It's my testicular hypothermia device.  It promotes motility by keeping my nether regions at a cool and constant ninety-six degrees.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  That wasn't me...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know!  I know that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Julia.  Hi.

speaker: Julia
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you.  What's all this?

speaker: Julia
text: It's dinner.  I know we said we'd go out, but I thought it'd be more fun to stay in.

speaker: Frasier
text: And what's in here?  Is this dessert?

speaker: Julia
text: Well, you could call it that.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Julia
text: Well, I'll just go start dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, looks like someone's getting lucky tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: She was, but I'm beginning to have second thoughts.

speaker: Niles
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Julia and I have never been together sexually.  Look what happened with Roz.  We slept together two ago, she's still suffering.

speaker: Frasier
text: In the sense of pining!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Frasier, you don't really suppose that after one night Julia...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, open your eyes, Niles!  It's the same scenario: an infatuated co-worker, a night of passion.  What if things don't work out between us?  Every day she'll be forced to stare through the glass at me.  Wondering what might have been, until one day, like Roz, she goes MAD!

speaker: Niles
text: Um... I'm leaving now.  Can I pick you up anything on Earth?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, don't you see?  I'm just trying to be responsible. I don't want to sleep with Julia until I know that there's a future for us.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Frasier, I'm sure you'll make the right choice.  But if you'll permit me an observation, you do tend to take things to extremes.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I have to plug myself into the cigarette lighter and recharge.

speaker: Julia
text: So, alone at last.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  But you know, there's really no need for you to go to all this trouble.  I mean, we can still have dinner at Chez Henri's.

speaker: Julia
text: No.  Dinner's coming along great.  In fact, I've got a little sauce right here if you want to taste it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh. _Instead of kissing her, he wipes the sauce with a cracker and takes a bite._

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.  That's yummy, yes.

speaker: Julia
text: I've had such a stressful day.  You know what would feel great?  A back rub.  You know where I could find a pair of strong, manly hands?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think Zoltan from the club makes house calls. Let me get you his number.

speaker: Julia
text: Frasier, is everything all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Julia
text: Because if you're not interested...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I am.  I am.  I'm very interested.  It's just that... before we take things to the next level, you should know there are certain risks.

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, my God, you've got a sexually transmitted dis...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no!  Of course not!  Of course not.  Although, in a manner of speaking...

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's Roz!

speaker: Julia
text: What's she doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  Listen, just give us a moment or two together and I'll get rid of her.

speaker: Julia
text: Fine.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Can I come in?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is everything okay?

speaker: Roz
text: Look, I know how crazy I've been acting lately.  Here last night, and today at the radio station.  I mean, I don't even understand it myself.  But  then I took a long walk and I think I've figured it out.  I just feel so stupid.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz.  Not stupid, human.  And all too vulnerable.  You've realized that you're in love with me.

speaker: Roz
text: No, that's not it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on...

speaker: Roz
text: I can see why you'd think that, based on how I've been acting, but that's not it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, okay, just to be clear.  You haven't been pining for me since we slept together?

speaker: Roz
text: God, no!  Weren't you there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hold that thought, I've got to get in the kitchen and move something back to the front burner.  _He hurries off.  Reset to - the kitchen as he enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia...

speaker: Julia
text: Oh let me guess: Roz is staying for dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  Just us.  Listen, I'd like to apologize for being skittish earlier.  I...just chalk it up to nerves.  I mean, after all, this is a big night for us.  We've never done this before.

speaker: Julia
text: I have.

speaker: Frasier
text: [__laughing__]  As have I.  What I meant was...

speaker: Julia
text: No, I know what you meant.  You're forgiven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Where were we?  Oh, here.  I believe we were about to sample some sauce.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's hot!  Oh, God!  I'll just go get rid of Roz. _He rushes out to the living room.  Reset to - the living room as he hurries in, grabs Roz and rushes her out the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, we've got so much to talk about, what do you say we pick this up again tomorrow over a cup of coffee?

speaker: Roz
text: [__laughing__] Okay.  Thank God.  You have quite the ego on you. We slept together like two years ago.  I mean what do you think you are, some kind of slow acting, time-release love bomb?

speaker: Frasier
text: [__outraged__] I don't remember you having any complaints when we were in bed.  I seem to recall hearing the term "stallion- like"!

speaker: Roz
text: I never said that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, one of us did!

speaker: Julia
text: Okay, this is just too weird.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia...

speaker: Julia
text: No, this is obviously a bad night for you. _She walks past them into the hall.  Frasier follows.  Reset to -- the hallway as Julia gets onto the elevator._

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Roz was just leaving.

speaker: Julia
text: Well, I'll send the elevator back up for her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia, I...

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I'm so sorry about that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's my fault.  I never should have let you in. _They go back inside.  Reset to - the living room as Frasier closes the door._

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I guess I've given Julia another reason to hate me.

speaker: Frasier
text: She doesn't hate you, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, she doesn't like me.  And when the girlfriend doesn't like the friend, guess who gets the boot?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not always true.

speaker: Roz
text: I just went through this with my dad.  I was always really close to him, even after my parents split up.  And six months ago, he married this woman I don't get along with and it's like I don't exist.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: That's what I finally realized tonight.  I guess I saw Julia getting her hooks into you and I, I freaked.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, the day a woman says I can't be friends with you is the day I know I picked the wrong woman.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, Julia has a dangerously hot meal cooking in the kitchen. Why don't you stay?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, that sounds great. [__getting up__] Wait.  She went to all this trouble to make this dinner for you, if she finds out I'm the one who ate it it'll kill her.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can't tell her, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, please?  _She skips into the kitchen after him.  FADE TO:  Scene Two - Niles's Apartment The living room is lit softly and music is playing on the stereo. Niles comes in the front, then looks around in confusion._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne!  What are you doing here?  I thought you had plans tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who says I don't? _She uses a remote to start the fireplace and gets a bottle of champagne out of the ice bucket._

speaker: Daphne
text: Champagne?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sounds wonderful.  On second thought, not tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just thought you might like something to wash down these oysters.

speaker: Niles
text: Oohhh... actually, I'm avoiding raw seafood.  Would it be too much trouble to put them in a bisque?

speaker: Daphne
text: Now?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry.  I'm just a little surprised by all this.

speaker: Daphne
text: I just thought I'd follow your father's advice: a little less science, a little more romance. _She kisses him, then notices the odd humming and beeping.  She draws back and stares at his pants._

speaker: Daphne
text: And apparently it's working.

speaker: Niles
text: That would be my TestiCool 2000.

speaker: Daphne
text: Your what?!

speaker: Niles
text: I should have told you this earlier, I had some disappointing news today.  It seems that I suffer from low motility and it might not be possible for us to conceive.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't be sorry.  We'll be all right.  There's so many things they can do these days to help infertile couples.

speaker: Niles
text: True.

speaker: Daphne
text: And until we find out more, I don't see why we don't give Mother Nature a shot.

speaker: Daphne
text: I took the test today, I'm ovulating.

speaker: Niles
text: [__taking it__] Ohhh... well, in that case, the last one upstairs...

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, Daph, this isn't the ovulation kit, it's the pregnancy test.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, silly me.  They look so much ali...

speaker: Niles
text: We're pregnant.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, my God, we are, aren't we?

speaker: Niles
text: But my slow sperm...

speaker: Daphne
text: I must have fast eggs.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, I love you!

speaker: Daphne
text: I love you too! _They embrace.  Niles's pants emit a sharp beeping noise and he begins jerking from electric shocks._

speaker: Niles
text: Ow, ooh, ah!  Something seems to be short-circuiting! _He stumbles up the stairs, twitching and gasping.  Daphne watches him go, then looks down and smiles, patting her belly._
